name: DIGITAL SCHOOL DREAM
description:
Start at either of the links below:

Spreadsheet

YouTube

DIGITAL SCHOOL DREAM is an experimental text/video adventure game controlled through a Google Sheets spreadsheet with outputs viewed on YouTube. In it, you will explore a school full of uncanny characters who you can solve inventory puzzles for. 

It was developed as part of NYU's "Queer and Trans Game Studies" class taught by Professor Whit Pow with the assignment parameters of creating a game in a software not designed for making games. It uses Google Sheets and YouTube to play, with assets designed in Photoshop and Autodesk Maya.
